intro: Polygala vaillantii, commonly known as the mountain polygala, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of China. It belongs to the family Polygalaceae and is characterized by its delicate, spirally arranged leaves and showy, pea-like flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or limestone soils and thrives in temperate climates. It is often found in alpine or subalpine habitats, where it adapts to harsh environmental conditions. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, Polygala vaillantii is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
